alert.note: Alert for Mellette; Todd; Tripp (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued December 19 at 1:19PM MST until December 21 at 5:00PM MST by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...EXTREME COLD AND DANGEROUS WIND CHILLS EXPECTED THROUGH FRIDAY... ...GROUND BLIZZARD CONDITIONS POSSIBLE LATE WEDNESDAY THROUGH EARLY FRIDAY... .A very cold airmass and fast moving storm system will bring dangerously cold wind chills to northeast Wyoming and western to south central South Dakota. A fast moving storm system will bring a quick shot of snow to much of the area Wednesday and Wednesday evening. Snow amounts will be limited to an inch or two, but northwest winds will increase Wednesday afternoon, resulting in extremely cold wind chills through Thursday and Friday. Strong winds across the western and central South Dakota plains will gust to 50-60 mph. With new snow on top of a powdery snowpack, ground blizzard conditions will be possible. ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TUESDAY TO 6 PM CST WEDNESDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... ...WIND CHILL WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY EVENING THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. For the Wind Chill Watch, dangerously cold wind chills possible. Wind chills as low as 50 below zero. For the Winter Storm Watch, blizzard conditions possible. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Mellette County, Todd County and Tripp County. This includes the Tribal Lands of the Rosebud Reservation. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 1 AM Tuesday to 6 PM CST Wednesday. For the Wind Chill Watch, from Wednesday evening through Friday afternoon. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Wednesday afternoon through Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Plan on difficult travel. Widespread blowing snow could create ground blizzard conditions. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes.
info.instruction: A wind chill advisory means the combination of wind and cold temperatures will create dangerously low wind chill values. If you go outside, cover all parts of your body, especially your head, face, and hands. A wind chill watch means dangerously low wind chill values are possible due to the combination of very cold air and wind. A Winter Storm Watch for blizzard conditions means falling and blowing snow with strong winds may produce dangerous whiteout conditions. Monitor NOAA weather radio, local radio or television, or the Internet for updates on this potentially dangerous storm. Take time to prepare for severe winter conditions before the storm develops.
